intro: Pentadesma butyracea, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces a thick, oily latex that has been used traditionally for various purposes. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its fruit, which is small and green, contains a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish pulp.
